content.description: SDS just right of arete on small crimps, paste some bad feet and burl a couple of move up to a set of ok jugs. From here work your way up a tough sloping topout.
content.location: Very bottom of the burlstain boulder

content.description: Stand start on the super blunt arete using a 'thumbdercling' and a knob on the right face. Move up awful slopers with the left hand to a barely there slopey top.
content.location: Left end of the north face of burlstain

content.description: Stand start on the slab using a vertical seam. Head straight up and top out at the crack.
content.location: Middle of the clean south face of burlstain boulder

content.description: Stand start on imperceptable holds at the right end of the slab, where a second boulder just barely touches to burlstain. Move tenuously up to the horizontal crack, traverse left, then negotiate the exciting moves up and off the crack into the black looking face above. Top out on forgiving slopers.
content.location: Far right on the south face of burlstain

climbs.name: The Land of Milk and Honey

content.description: A stand start in two different spot takes you to a pocket/rail feature about halfway up the boulder. Move up and right from this to slopers then crimps just over the lip of the boulder. Either top out here or step right to top out at the crack.
content.location: Middle of the clean southfacing side of burlstain boulder

content.description: SDS on backside of Burlstain on a right leaning side pull. Either move staright up the v shaped break, or move slightly right to ascend the right side of the V.
content.location: back side of the burlstain boulder

content.description: Stand start on two very small crimps and fire up and left to a crimp at the base of the vertical seam used on 'forcing the hark'. Follow finger crack to the top.
content.location: north side of the burlstain boulder

content.description: Stand start just right of 'thumbdercling' with a right hand on the knob. Follow the crack to the left and stab to a crimp where the vertical and horizontal seams meet. Climb up the short finger crack to the highstep topout.
content.location: north side of the burlstain boulder

content.description: An absolutely beautiful boulderers boulder with perfect flat landings, top outs that are just difficult enough to keep it interesting, and just tall enough to get the adrenaline going without actually being dangerous. So Good.
